page.title: 16HOUSING
page.content: The predominant housing area within the block is the Westlands Estate. Formerly named Boycott Farm Estate, its first inhabitants took up residence early in January 1969 and development continued for some nine years until completion. The 1981 census population figure for Westlands Estate was 3536. The dwellings themselves are a mixture of 2-bedroomed, 3-bedroomed and 4-bedroomed houses with bungalow dwellings available for the elderly and some families. Two low-rise blocks of flats were also built. The estate is built in blocks, the name of each associated with farming,e.g. Ploughman's, Farriers, Crofters. There is no through access for traffic; the estate is bounded by a main traffic thoroughfare.
